clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of VM202 in the Treatment of Chronic Non-Healing Foot Ulcers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study to Asses the Safety and Efficacy of VM202 to Treat Chronic Nonhealing Foot Ulcers in Diabetic Patients With Concomitant Peripheral Arterial Disease (PAD)

lead_sponsor.agency: ViroMed Co., Ltd. dba VM BioPharma

clinical_study.source: ViroMed Co., Ltd. dba VM BioPharma

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the safety and efficacy of using gene therapy via intramuscular injections of the calf for patients with chronic non-healing foot ulcers.

detailed_description.textblock:
A phase III, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multicenter, 7-month study designed to assess the safety and efficacy of intramuscular (IM) injections in the calf of VM202 in patients with chronic nonhealing foot ulcers. Three hundred patients will be randomized in a 2:1 ratio of VM202 or placebo injections:
- Active -VM202 + standard of care - 200 patients
- Control - Placebo (VM202 Vehicle) + standard of care - 100 patients

primary_outcome.measure: Confirmed target wound closure by the 4 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with a confirmed target wound closure by the 4 month follow-up. Complete wound closure is defined as skin re-epithelialization without drainage or dressing confirmed at two consecutive study visits at least two weeks apart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to complete wound closure of foot ulcer
Proportion of subjects with a confirmed target wound closure prior to or at 7 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 2 months, 3 months, 4 months, and 7 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent change in wound area and wound depth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 2 months, 3 months, 4 months, and 7 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with formation of new ulcers on the target foot
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 2 months, 3 months, 4 months, and 7 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in each domain score (quality of life, social life, well-being, physical symptoms and daily living) of Cardiff Wound Impact Questionnaire (CWIQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline at 4 months and 7 month
